awd_titl_txt: T1 Upgrade Connection to NSFNet Through Merit/Michnet
awd_abstract_narration: The Grand Valley State University requests support from NSF                for an upgrade of their slow speed connection to a medium speed                 connection of its campus network to NSFNET via MICHnet, Michigan's              regional network.  MICHnet will provide operations and network                  information services and it will provide Grand Valley State with a              high speed connection to the NSFNET, a high speed (1.5 - 45 million             bits per second) National Backbone network.                                          The University needs greater functionality and network speed               to be able to access supercomputers, libraries, and make file                   transfers along with being able to implement a more reliable mail               system.  Students and faculty research will benefit from the link.              This is also a unique opportunity for the school to explore                     innovative educational resources.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
